topics.body:
There are several strong musical traditions that are predominantly christian in nature. Gospel music, many, many hymns, the majority of Christmas music that is actually fucking listenable and I'm sure more that I am forgetting.

However as a rule when ever someone tries to make explicitly christian music of a more modern type it usually sucks balls. Usually.

The reason for this is quite simple really, expressly christian music comes from a much smaller talent pool than secular music and therefor there is a bit of a big fish in a small pond thing going on so odds are good that an extraordinary christian artist is in fact really just mediocre by the standards of that broader genre.

However, and this is a big fat ugly however, musical tastes are mostly subjective and I argue that what is important in terms of music is what speaks to you personally.

I know this because I lived it. For a long time all I listened to was christian music plus the odd secular album that I could sneak or that my parents, in fact usually my dad, also dug and I will always hold some fondness for the christian bands that got me into the types of music I love today.

"Zao":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPeQGTDOr5g
"Blaster the Rocket Man":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C7xeOgs7nAs
"Five Iron Frenzy":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4NCfAO2ulBM
